docs.lead_paragraph: Former Florida Gov. Jeb Bush is condemning the Obama administration's use of "coercive federal power" to limit religious freedom as he courts Christian conservatives ahead of a likely presidential run.

headline.main: Jeb Bush: Stronger 'Christian Voice' Needed in World
headline.print_headline: Jeb Bush: Stronger 'Christian Voice' Needed in World

docs.snippet: Former Florida Gov. Jeb Bush is condemning the Obama administration's use of "coercive federal power" to limit religious freedom as he courts Christian conservatives ahead of a likely presidential run.

docs.lead_paragraph: A poll finds that many people in the United States question whether the Supreme Court can rule fairly in the latest litigation that's jeopardizing President Barack Obama's health care law.

headline.main: AP-GfK Poll: Can Supreme Court Be Fair in Health Law Case?
headline.print_headline: AP-GfK Poll: Can Supreme Court Be Fair in Health Law Case?

docs.snippet: A poll finds that many people in the United States question whether the Supreme Court can rule fairly in the latest litigation that's jeopardizing President Barack Obama's health care law.

docs.lead_paragraph: Potential Republican presidential candidate Jeb Bush will seek on Saturday to increase his appeal among evangelical Christians, a significant voting bloc, in an appearance at a Christian university.

headline.main: At Christian University, Jeb Bush Seeks Support From Evangelicals
headline.print_headline: At Christian University, Jeb Bush Seeks Support From Evangelicals

docs.snippet: Potential Republican presidential candidate Jeb Bush will seek on Saturday to increase his appeal among evangelical Christians, a significant voting bloc, in an appearance at a Christian university.

docs.lead_paragraph: Health officials will require insurers to update doctor directories and hope to help patients estimate out-of-pocket costs.

headline.main: White House Moves to Fix 2 Key Consumer Complaints About Health Care Law
headline.print_headline: White House Moves to Fix 2 Key Consumer Complaints About Health Care Law

docs.abstract: Obama administration is taking steps to fix two most common complaints about health plans under Affordable Care Act, one being inaccuracy of doctor directories and another regarding patients being blindsided with bills for costs that their insurance would not cover.
docs.snippet: Health officials will require insurers to update doctor directories and hope to help patients estimate out-of-pocket costs.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Loss-of-value insurance, intended to protect athletes who may become injured and miss out on money they would have received from professional contracts, is not as helpful as it may seem, critics say.

headline.main: Insurance Doesn’t Eliminate Risk for Top College Athletes Who Forgo Draft
headline.print_headline: Insurance Doesn’t End Risk for Top College Athletes Who Forgo Draft

docs.abstract: Colleges are increasingly offering loss-of-value insurance as incentive for players to stay for senior year rather than enter NFL draft; insurance is meant to compensate student athletes for lesser contracts they may receive as result of injuries sustained in final year of school, but no player has been known to collect on it.
docs.snippet: Loss-of-value insurance, intended to protect athletes who may become injured and miss out on money they would have received from professional contracts, is not as helpful as it may seem, critics say.

docs.lead_paragraph: Florida Gov. Rick Scott, a longtime opponent of "Obamacare," made a startling announcement shortly after his mother's death, going on TV two years ago to explain that he had dropped his objections to President Barack Obama's health care overhaul.

headline.main: Florida Budget Snarled as Governor Challenges 'Obamacare'
headline.print_headline: Florida Budget Snarled as Governor Challenges 'Obamacare'

docs.snippet: Florida Gov. Rick Scott, a longtime opponent of "Obamacare," made a startling announcement shortly after his mother's death, going on TV two years ago to explain that he had dropped his objections to President Barack Obama's health care overhaul.

docs.lead_paragraph: The exchange, itBit, said it was taking on customers after receiving a banking trust charter from Benjamin Lawsky, the state’s financial regulator.

headline.main: Bitcoin Exchange Receives First License in New York State
headline.print_headline: ItBit Bitcoin Exchange Gets Banking License in New York, a First in U.S.

docs.abstract: New York State's Dept of Financial Services issues first license to a Bitcoin exchange, authorizing itBit to open legally to customers across country; company announces that it has won $25 million in new financing.
docs.snippet: The exchange, itBit, said it was taking on customers after receiving a banking trust charter from Benjamin Lawsky, the state’s financial regulator.
